entries.title: Chiefs Patrick Mahomes Has A High Ankle Sprain, Here’s What This Means
entries.description: This is what makes a high ankle sprain different from more common ankle sprains and why recovery takes longer.

entries.title: Automotive LiDAR - Still Alive & Kicking
entries.description: Going into 2023, LiDAR (Light Detection and Ranging - a 3D imaging technology) seemed to be a struggling industry. CES at Las Vegas inspires feelings of hope, risks and payoffs.  It shows what is possible and is an optimistic beginning to every New Year.

entries.title: Forget The New MacBook Pro, Apple Has Something Better
entries.description: There are better options than Apple's all-out approach to performance in the new MacBook Pro laptops...

entries.title: Dyslexic Thinking For Sustainability
entries.description: Neurodiverse people like me spend a lifetime learning how to fit into a neurotypical world. But perhaps everyone could learn from us about how to do things differently. Thinking like a dyslexic, even if you aren’t one, opens up an exciting world of sustainability solutions.

entries.title: A New Player Enters The Arena: Dollar General Launches Health Clinics
entries.description: The traditionally consumer retail company sees a huge opportunity in healthcare delivery.

entries.title: New Multi-Drug Resistant Gonorrhea Detected In U.S., 2 Cases In Massachusetts
entries.description: These were the first cases in the U.S. of Neisseria gonorrhoeae being resistant to six of seven types of antibiotics.

entries.title: An Atmospheric Scientist Explains That Viral Rose-Colored ‘UFO’ Cloud
entries.description: There are a lot of hoax or fake weather pictures on social media, but the viral pictures of a rose-colored cloud in Turkey are legitimate. Here is an explanation.

entries.title: My Highest Winrate ‘Marvel Snap’ Deck, Zabu Discard
entries.description: While I have been experimenting with a whole lot of different Zabu decks since he became the new featured card of this Savage Land season of Marvel Snap, one has risen to the top in the final week here.

entries.title: Apple HomePod Mini 2 Surprise Cancellation Leaks In New Report
entries.description: If you want a smaller HomePod, there’s no successor to the current one in the works, it seems.

entries.title: Here’s Aubrey Plaza As M3GAN 2.0 For ‘SNL’
entries.description: Well, SNL ran with that concept, dressing up a few of its cast members and host Aubrey Plaza as M3GANs for a 2.0 update of the concept, leaning into the fact that M3GAN has not just become a new horror icon, but a new gay horror icon.

entries.title: HBO’s ‘The Last Of Us’ Season 2 Is Essentially Guaranteed Already
entries.description: While TV viewers these days are conditioned not to get too attached to a show they like, lest the streaming service it’s airing on cancel it for some unknowable reason, I don’t think early fans of The Last of Us’ premiere on HBO have anything to worry about, despite no immediate season 2 renewal

entries.title: Three ‘Destiny 2’ HELM Vendor Farms To Do Before Lightfall
entries.description: While Bungie is no longer content vaulting full Destiny 2 expansions, they are still deleting all or most seasonal content every year. In this case, that means the erasure of not just the seasonal activities from this year, but the vendors associated with them.

entries.title: 343 Says It's Still Making ‘Halo,’ Despite Layoffs And Speculation
entries.description: The short statement was meant to quell rumors that 343 was being taken off Halo after these layoffs and general underperformance from Halo Infinite.

entries.title: Relentless European Electric Car Sales Success Will Include Chinese Disruption
entries.description: European battery electric vehicle sales might stutter a bit in 2023 but for the rest of the decade there will be seamless, accelerating growth, forecasters say. The stark forecasts hide the possibility of major controversies as Chinese carmakers win valuable market share.

entries.title: A Data Gap Continues To Inhibit Artificial Intelligence
entries.description: Yes, there is plenty of data flowing through enterprises, but harnessing it in a productive and unbiased way is another story.

entries.title: Generative AI ChatGPT Is Going To Be Everywhere Once The API Portal Gets Soon Opened, Stupefying AI Ethics And AI Law
entries.description: Generative AI ChatGPT is already in the news and will likely garner added attention once the API portal access is opened, leading to either a boon in new uses or a bust in terms of adverse consequences. Here's the scoop.

entries.title: WhatsApp For iPhone’s New Feature Wants You To Talk To Yourself
entries.description: New features rolling out now mean you can always chat, even if nobody else is there.

entries.title: Loft Labs Eyes Higher Tier Of Cloud
entries.description: Loft is seeing increasing traction because it helps control cost and deliver Kubernetes wherever it is deployed (on-premises or any cloud) while providing an easy entry point for developers shielding them from much of the complexity of Kubernetes.

entries.title: Today’s ‘Quordle’ Answers And Clues For Sunday, January 22
entries.description: Some hints and the solution for today's 'Quordle' are just ahead.

entries.title: Today’s ‘Heardle’ Answer And Clues For Sunday, January 22
entries.description: Here's today's 'Heardle' song, along with some hints.

entries.title: Today’s Wordle #582 Hint, Clues And Answer For Sunday January 22nd
entries.description: How to solve today's Wordle.

entries.title: Found: A Super-Bright ‘Zombie Star’ Last Seen 842 Years Ago
entries.description: The explosive remains of the collision of two dying stars last seen in the year 1181 have been identified as a nebula in the constellation Cassiopeia.

entries.title: Are You Suffering From Social-Media-Induced Loneliness?
entries.description: Social media’s biggest draw is that it allows us to connect with each other, so why does it make us feel so lonely?
